alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:43PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Crawford, western Sebastian, northeastern Haskell, Sequoyah and Le Flore Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Vian to 4 miles northeast of Keota to 5 miles south of Lake Wister State Park to 3 miles east of Muse. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Poteau... Pocola... Muldrow... Heavener... Roland... Spiro... Arkoma... Vian... Panama... Wister... Hackett... Howe... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Bokoshe... Midland... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 295 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 5 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
